content:
**No additional fee is required:**

You don't need to pay an additional fee for the new photo. The original application fee you paid on January 25th covers the cost of processing your passport name change application, including any necessary updates to your photo.

**The Department of State's policy:**

According to the U.S. Department of State, if you need to submit a new photo as part of your passport application, you don't need to pay an additional fee. The original application fee covers the cost of processing your application, including any necessary updates to your photo.

**What you've already paid:**

When you submitted your passport name change application on January 25th, you likely paid the following fees:

* Application fee: $110 for a U.S. passport book or $40 for a U.S. passport card, or $140 for both
* Execution fee: $35 for the acceptance agent's fee

These fees cover the cost of processing your application, including any necessary updates to your photo.

**No additional payment required:**

Since you've already paid the required fees, you don't need to pay anything extra for the new photo. Simply send the new photo with a note explaining the situation, and the National Passport Processing Center will update your application accordingly.

If you have any concerns or questions, you can always contact the National Passport Information Center at 1-877-487-2778 (TDD/TTY: 1-888-874-7793) for assistance.
